edu.vserver.exercises.model
Interface SubmissionStatisticsGiver<E extends ExerciseData,S extends SubmissionInfo>

Type Parameters:
E - ExerciseData specific to the exercise-type
S - SubmissionInfo specific to the exercise-type
All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.VoidSubmissionDataStatsGiver
public interface SubmissionStatisticsGiver<E extends ExerciseData,S extends SubmissionInfo>
extends java.io.Serializable

An implementor of this class knows how to derive interesting statistical info of submissions made to certain exercise.

An example of this kind of info: which of some exercises sub-questions was the most difficult ie. users received on average the lowest score from.

Author:
Riku Haavisto, Johannes Holvitie

Method Detail

initialize

void initialize(E exercise,
                java.util.List<StatisticalSubmissionInfo<S>> dataObjects,
                ResourceGiver localizer)
                throws ExerciseException
Loads the statistics-giver with data. The method initializes the statistics-giver-object.

Parameters:
exercise - ExerciseData object to be loaded; this is the exercise all the submissions were made to
dataObjects - a list of StatisticalSubmissionInfo-wrappers of submissions made to given exercise that are going to be analyzed
localizer - ResourceGiver making it possible to localize UI
Throws:
ExerciseException

getView

Component getView()
Returns:
The GUI through which the user can view different statistics about the loaded data

exportStatisticsDataAsText

java.lang.String exportStatisticsDataAsText()
The statistics represented as text. The most useful format would be loadable to some statistics-analysis program. For example a comma-separated values -file

Returns:
The statistics represented as text
See Also:
Comma-separated values on Wikipedia
